meanings.definition: The movement or growth of an organism in response to chemical stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The plant's chemotropism led its roots towards the nutrient-rich soil.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study chemotropism to understand how organisms respond to their environment.
meanings.sent3: The chemotropism of the bacteria towards the sugar solution was like a magnet pulling them in.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity acted as a chemotropism, guiding her towards new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The chemotropism of the ants towards the food source was swift and precise.

meanings.definition: The orientation or direction of growth of an organism in response to chemical signals.
meanings.sent1: The chemotropism of the vine allowed it to climb towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The bee's chemotropism towards the flower was essential for pollination.
meanings.sent3: The chemotropism of the tree towards the water source seemed almost intentional.
meanings.sent4: His ambition acted as a chemotropism, guiding him towards success.
meanings.sent5: The chemotropism of the roots seeking out nutrients was a marvel of nature.
